verses.verse: (1 Wisdom exhorteth to obey her.5 She teacheth the fear of God.6 She is given of God.10 She preserveth from wickedness.) My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and (That is, keep them in thine heart.) hide my commandments within thee,
And cause thine ears to hearken unto wisdom, and incline (If thou give thyself to the true knowledge of God without hypocrisy.) thine heart to understanding,
(For if thou callest after knowledge, (Meaning, that we must seek the knowledge of God with care and diligence.) and cryest for understanding:
If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for (Showing that no labor must be spared.) treasures,
Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the (This (saith he) is the true wisdom, to know and fear God.) knowledge of God.
For the Lord giveth wisdom, out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
He (Or, hideth the salvation.) preserveth the state of the righteous, he is a shield to them that walk uprightly,
That they may keep the ways of judgment: and he preserveth the way of his Saints).
Then shalt thou understand righteousness and judgment, and equity, and every good path.
Â¶ When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge delighteth thy soul,
Then shall (The word of God shall teach thee, and counsel thee how to govern thyself.) counsel preserve thee, and understanding shall keep thee,
And deliver thee from the evil way, and from the man that speaketh froward things,
And from them that leave the (That is, the word of God, which is the only light, to follow their own fantasies which are darkness.) ways of righteousness to walk in the ways of darkness:
Which rejoice in doing evil, and delight (When they see any given to evil as they are.) in the frowardness of the wicked,
Whose ways are crooked, and they are lewd in their paths.

And it shall deliver thee from the strange (Meaning, that wisdom which is the word of God, shall preserve us from all vices: naming this vice of whoredom whereunto man is most prone.) woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

Which forsaketh the (That is, her husband, which is her head and guide to govern her, from whom she ought not to depart, but remain in his subjection.) guide of her youth, and forgetteth the (Which is the promise made in marriage.) covenant of her God.
Surely her (Her acquaintance with her familiars, and them that haunt her.) house tendeth to death, and her paths unto (To them that are dead in body and soul.) the dead.
All they that go unto her, return not again, neither take they hold of the ways of life.
Therefore walk thou in the way of good men, and keep the ways of the righteous.
For the just shall dwell in the (They shall enjoy the temporal and spiritual promises of God, as the wicked shall be void of them.) land, and the upright men shall remain in it.
But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressor shall be rooted out of it.
